Categories.value: Attic red-figure pottery in the British Museum|Details of ancient Greek pottery|Makron|Room 15, British Museum|Self-published work

ImageDescription.value:
object type / vase shape: attic red figure skyphos

- description: Triptolemos on his winged chariot and gods; name inscriptions: DEMETRE, TRIPPTOLEMOS, PHEROPHATTA, ELEUSIS, EUMOLPPOS, ZEUS, DIONNYSOS, ANPHITRITE, POSEIDON - production place: Athens - potter: Hieron, signded on one handle (incised): HIERON EPOIESEN - painter: Makron (middle work, group II) - period / date: late archaic, transition to early classical, ca. 490 BC - material: pottery (clay) - height: 21,1 cm; diameter (without handles): 26,4 cm - findspot: Santa Maria di Capua - museum / inventory number: London, British Museum 1873, 0820.375 Cat. Vases E 140 - bibliography: John D. Beazley, Attic Red-Figure Vase-Painters, Oxford 1963(2), 459,3 - Norbert Kunisch, Makron, Mainz 1997, cat. 319

- Please note: The above museum permits photography of its exhibits for private, educational, scientific, non-commercial purposes. If you intend to use the photo for any commercial aime, please contact the museum and ask for permission.
